title: How to Make a Tire Rocker

steps.headline: Find yourself an old tire, clean it very well and measure and find it's center.
Mark the center with a line using a chalk or pentel pen.
Get a very sharp knife or a hacksaw and cut the tire in half using the markings you made as a guide.
steps.description:
Be very careful in cutting the tire in half although there are couple of ways in accomplishing this. You can use a power grinder, a knife and block but the simplest way is using a hacksaw. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/0a\/Make-a-Tire-Rocker-Step-3Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-a-Tire-Rocker-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/0a\/Make-a-Tire-Rocker-Step-3Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-a-Tire-Rocker-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Clean the tire once more and then primer it with white paint since all tires are black.
steps.description:
it is imperative that you paint it white as a primer in order for you to add your desired color to it. Paint it according your liking. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/03\/Make-a-Tire-Rocker-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-a-Tire-Rocker-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/03\/Make-a-Tire-Rocker-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-a-Tire-Rocker-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Cut to blocks measuring the same width as the interior walls your tire, this will serve as support at the same time this is where you will mount the platform of your rocker.
Put the blocks on each side of the tire.
steps.description:
Get some wood screw. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/f7\/Make-a-Tire-Rocker-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-a-Tire-Rocker-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/f7\/Make-a-Tire-Rocker-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-a-Tire-Rocker-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Screw the blocks inside the screw. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/51\/Make-a-Tire-Rocker-Step-6Bullet2.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-a-Tire-Rocker-Step-6Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/51\/Make-a-Tire-Rocker-Step-6Bullet2.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-a-Tire-Rocker-Step-6Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Measure the length of tire and cut a wooden plank.
steps.description: This will be seat of your rocker.

steps.headline: Attach your platform to the blocks that you attached inside your tire.
steps.description: Grab a fine grit sandpaper and smooth the surface

steps.headline: Drill 2 holes for the rope or handles of this rocker.
Insert a rope into the holes you made the tie a knot on each end to secure it.
Add a some finishing touches or decorate it and let your kid enjoy her new rocker!

text:
Find yourself an old tire, clean it very well and measure and find it's center. Mark the center with a line using a chalk or pentel pen. Get a very sharp knife or a hacksaw and cut the tire in half using the markings you made as a guide. Be very careful in cutting the tire in half although there are couple of ways in accomplishing this. You can use a power grinder, a knife and block but the simplest way is using a hacksaw. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0a/Make-a-Tire-Rocker-Step-3Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-Tire-Rocker-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0a/Make-a-Tire-Rocker-Step-3Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Make-a-Tire-Rocker-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use (screenshot)

"} Clean the tire once more and then primer it with white paint since all tires are black. it is imperative that you paint it white as a primer in order for you to add your desired color to it. Paint it according your liking. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/03/Make-a-Tire-Rocker-Step-4Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-Tire-Rocker-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/03/Make-a-Tire-Rocker-Step-4Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Make-a-Tire-Rocker-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use (screenshot)

"} Cut to blocks measuring the same width as the interior walls your tire, this will serve as support at the same time this is where you will mount the platform of your rocker. Put the blocks on each side of the tire. Get some wood screw. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f7/Make-a-Tire-Rocker-Step-6Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-Tire-Rocker-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f7/Make-a-Tire-Rocker-Step-6Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Make-a-Tire-Rocker-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use (screenshot)

"} Screw the blocks inside the screw. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/51/Make-a-Tire-Rocker-Step-6Bullet2.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-Tire-Rocker-Step-6Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/51/Make-a-Tire-Rocker-Step-6Bullet2.jpg/v4-759px-Make-a-Tire-Rocker-Step-6Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use (screenshot)

"} Measure the length of tire and cut a wooden plank. This will be seat of your rocker. Attach your platform to the blocks that you attached inside your tire. Grab a fine grit sandpaper and smooth the surface Drill 2 holes for the rope or handles of this rocker. Paint the seat. Insert a rope into the holes you made the tie a knot on each end to secure it. Add a some finishing touches or decorate it and let your kid enjoy her new rocker!
